caption:
Vast and ever-shifting, the sea has always been emblematic of life‚Äôs dualities: beautiful but treacherous, clear yet vague, the beginnings and inevitable endings. ‚ÄúAll at Sea‚Äù is a project focussing on the expansive and unpredictable nature of the ocean and linking it with our own human emotions. It is a somewhat melancholic nod to my Father, a sailor who died in 2010, and is an ongoing conversation with myself, exploring concepts such as memory, relationship, time, place and the strange waves of conflicting emotions that have arisen since he passed. 

@finn - 2024

I‚Äôm delighted to have been invited to sit on the jury panel for the 2024 @riba Awards by the @the_rsaw. I‚Äôm not a trained architect, but having helped design and build our house (above), which won 5 RIBA awards this year and the Gold Medal for Architecture, I hope to bring a different but valuable perspective to the panel! Looking forward to the site visits, which begin in the spring.

New year, new personal project.

My son and I recently discussed The Soul Hypothesis - the belief that souls exist and that humans have them. This immaterial part of a human being, often regarded as immortal, is impossible to prove or disprove, but a good portrait is universally thought capable of immortalising or carrying the soul, so he set me the challenge. I hand-painted a canvas backdrop over the holidays with the intention of making a series of new portraits this year. I am limited to simple setups that lean on purposeful, elegant posing ‚Äì something of a test, as much of my photography falls into the environmental category. My backdrop can travel to locations, but its physical constraints will force me to work with just the person themselves‚Äîmy only aid: light and an ability to relate.¬†¬†

So here we go, some slides from my first session yesterday. Thank you, @hayward151, for assisting, and @cloudmaker_and_the_wolf, for bringing your boys and the whirlwind surrounding them to my backdrop. The last slide shows these wee legends turning the tables on their photographer - I love it.
A portrait of my daughter and a definite addition to my Soul Hypothesis project. I love the touch of thirteen-year-old-reluctance in her eyes üñ§
More Scottish Scandi goodness from Lundies House in the Highlands for Audi. Great shoot with great people and much inspiration for our own house build ‚ú®

Another ad I directed for @lloydsbankbusiness here. This one for @colwithfarmdistillery, who makes award-winning vodka from spuds! 

As the great Capa said: ‚ÄòIf your pictures aren‚Äôt good enough, you‚Äôre not close enough.‚Äô We used close-up action windows as building blocks or visual clues to help enrich the narrative and keep the audience engaged. We pushed this further with GoPros, body cams, probe lenses and custom-built rigs to drop the viewer into places you wouldn‚Äôt usually have access to - the spud cam being a particular highlight! It‚Äôs such a fun campaign to work on with an awesome crew, an encouraging agency (@aandeddb), and a trusting client who lets us run with these ideas üôèüèª Swipe for stills and some BTS of the spud cam in action!

More to come in 2024 ‚ú®

New work for @audiuk and their new Q8 e-tron‚Äî a rare bit of sunshine in early December saw us embrace the ‚Äòslow travel‚Äô ethos of the UK‚Äôs latest EV-friendly driving route through Devon and Cornwall. Loved this wee Kingswear Ferry, that has linked both sides of the River Dart since the 1700s.
